comment.text: Seems fine on x86_64 and aarch64
Works fine in conjunction with virt-manager and KVM virtual machines.
Works fine, sorry for 2 previous comments

bugs.title: CVE-2015-5225 Qemu: ui: vnc: heap memory corruption in vnc_refresh_server_surface

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-5225 Qemu: ui: vnc: heap memory corruption in vnc_refresh_server_surface

long_desc.thetext:
Qemu emulator built with the VNC display driver support is vulnerable to a
buffer overflow flaw leading to heap memory corruption. It could occur while
refreshing the server display surface via routine vnc_refresh_server_surface().

A privileged guest user could use this flaw to corrupt the heap memory and crash the Qemu process instance OR potentially use it to execute arbitrary code on the host.

Upstream fix:
-------------
  -> https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2015-08/msg02495.html

Issue introduced by:
--------------------
  -> http://git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=bea60dd7679364493a0d7f5b

Created qemu tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1255899]

Statement: 

This issue does not affect the versions of kvm and xen packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

This issue does not affect the versions of the qemu-kvm packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7.

This issue does not affect the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 based versions of qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This issue does affect the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 based versions of the qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3. Future updates for this release may address this flaw.

Acknowledgements:

Red Hat would like to thank Mr Qinghao Tang from QIHU 360 Inc. and Mr Zuozhi from Alibaba Inc. for reporting this issue.
qemu-2.4.0-2.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  OpenStack 5 for RHEL 7
  OpenStack 6 for RHEL 7
  OpenStack 7 For RHEL 7

Via RHSA-2015:1772 https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-1772.html
qemu-2.3.1-3.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  RHEV-H and Agents for RHEL-7

Via RHSA-2015:1837 https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-1837.html
qemu-2.1.3-11.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

comment.text: Seems fine on x86_64 and aarch64
Works fine in conjunction with virt-manager and KVM virtual machines.
Works fine, sorry for 2 previous comments

bugs.title: CVE-2015-5278 qemu: Infinite loop in ne2000_receive() function

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-5278 qemu: Infinite loop in ne2000_receive() function

long_desc.thetext:
Qemu emulator built with the NE2000 NIC emulation support is vulnerable to an infinite loop issue. It could occur when receiving packets over the network.

A privileged user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the Qemu instance resulting in DoS.

Upstream fix:
-------------
  -> https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2015-09/msg03985.html

Reference:
----------
  -> http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/09/15/2

Created attachment 1066776
Crash report

Statement: 

This issue affects the versions of kvm and xen packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

This issue affects the versions of the qemu-kvm packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7.

This issue affects the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 based versions of qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This issue affects the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 based versions of the qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This has been rated as having Moderate security impact and is not currently
planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer
to the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle:
https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

Acknowledgements:

This issue was discovered by Qinghao Tang of QIHU 360 Inc.

Created xen tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1263281]

Created qemu tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1263284]

bugs.title: CVE-2015-6815 qemu: net: e1000: infinite loop issue

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-6815 qemu: net: e1000: infinite loop issue

long_desc.thetext:
Qemu emulator built with the e1000 NIC emulation support is vulnerable to an
infinite loop issue. It could occur while processing transmit descriptor data
when sending a network packet.

A privileged user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the Qemu instance
resulting in DoS.

Upstream fix:
-------------
  -> https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2015-09/msg01199.html

Statement: 

This issue affects the versions of kvm and xen packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

This issue affects the versions of the qemu-kvm packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7.

This issue affects the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 based versions of qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This issue affect the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 based versions of the qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This has been rated as having Low security impact and is not currently
planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer
to the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle:
https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

Acknowledgements:

This issue was discovered by Qinghao Tang of QIHU 360 Inc.

Created xen tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1260224]

Created qemu tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1260225]

This issue has been assigned CVE-2015-6815 via:


http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/09/05/5

bugs.title: CVE-2015-6855 Qemu: ide: divide by zero issue

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-6855 Qemu: ide: divide by zero issue

long_desc.thetext:
Qemu emulator built with the IDE disk and CD/DVD-ROM emulation support is
vulnerable to a divide by zero issue. It could occur while executing an IDE
command WIN_READ_NATIVE_MAX to determine the maximum size of a drive.

A privileged user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the Qemu instance
resulting in DoS.

Upstream fix:
-------------
  -> git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=d9033e1d3aa666c5071580617a57bd853c5d794a

Reference:
----------
  -> http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/09/10/1

Statement: 

This issue affects the versions of kvm and xen packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

This issue affects the versions of the qemu-kvm packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7.

This issue affects the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 based versions of qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This issue affect the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 based versions of the qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This has been rated as having Low security impact and is not currently
planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer
to the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle:
https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

Acknowledgements:

This issue was discovered by Qinghao Tang of QIHU 360 Inc.

Created xen tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1261792]

Created qemu tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1261793]

Qemu emulator built with the IDE disk and CD/DVD-ROM emulation support is
vulnerable to a divide by zero issue. It could occur while executing an IDE
command WIN_READ_NATIVE_MAX to determine the maximum size of a drive.

A privileged user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the Qemu instance
resulting in DoS.

Upstream fix:
-------------
  -> git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=d9033e1d3aa666c5071580617a57bd853c5d794a

Reference:
----------
  -> http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/09/10/1

Statement: 

This issue affects the versions of kvm and xen packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

This issue affects the versions of the qemu-kvm packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7.

This issue affects the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 based versions of qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This issue affect the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 based versions of the qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This has been rated as having Low security impact and is not currently
planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer
to the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle:
https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

Acknowledgements:

This issue was discovered by Qinghao Tang of QIHU 360 Inc.

Created xen tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1261792]

Created qemu tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1261793]

long_desc.thetext:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #1264673 +++

Consume the qemu version that will include fix for BZ 1262901
=================================================================

As per discussion with Amit Shah, this fix is included in qemu-kvm-rhev-2.3.0-13.el7

Target release should be placed once a package build is known to fix a issue. Since this bug is not modified, the target version has been reset. Please use target milestone to plan a fix for a oVirt release.

In oVirt testing is done on single release by default. Therefore I'm removing the 4.0 flag. If you think this bug must be tested in 4.0 as well, please re-add the flag. Please note we might not have testing resources to handle the 4.0 clone.

[root@green-vdsc ~]# rpm -q --requires vdsm-4.17.14-0.el7ev.noarch |grep qemu
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu
qemu-img-rhev >= 10:2.3.0-31.el7_2.4
qemu-kvm-rhev >= 10:2.3.0-31.el7_2.4
Consume the qemu version that will include fix for BZ 1262901
Fixed bug tickets must have version flags set prior to fixing them. Please set the correct version flags and move the bugs back to the previous status after this is corrected.
Yaniv, what just happened here? It seems that all the flags are set correctly

(In reply to Tal Nisan from comment #2)
> Yaniv, what just happened here? It seems that all the flags are set correctly

There are no version flags on this bug. Please add them and move the bug back.

Hi,

Could you please provide the steps to reproduce this bug.

Target release should be placed once a package build is known to fix a issue. Since this bug is not modified, the target version has been reset. Please use target milestone to plan a fix for a oVirt release.

Hi,

Could you please provide the steps to reproduce this bug
Bug tickets that are moved to testing must have target release set to make sure tester knows what to test. Please set the correct target release before moving to ON_QA.

(In reply to Kevin Alon Goldblatt from comment #6)
> Hi,
> 
> Could you please provide the steps to reproduce this bug

You don't need to verify libvirt's fix - that's virt qe's domain.
The verification on oVirt's side is to make sure that VDSM on Fedora pulls a libvirt dependency of (at least) 2.1.3-11.

(In reply to Allon Mureinik from comment #8)
> (In reply to Kevin Alon Goldblatt from comment #6)

> You don't need to verify libvirt's fix - that's virt qe's domain.
> The verification on oVirt's side is to make sure that VDSM on Fedora pulls a

arg, my mistak - qemu, not libvirt.
apologies.

bugs.title: CVE-2015-5278 qemu: Infinite loop in ne2000_receive() function [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-5278 qemu: Infinite loop in ne2000_receive() function [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-5278 qemu: Infinite loop in ne2000_receive() function

long_desc.thetext:
Qemu emulator built with the NE2000 NIC emulation support is vulnerable to an infinite loop issue. It could occur when receiving packets over the network.

A privileged user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the Qemu instance resulting in DoS.

Upstream fix:
-------------
  -> https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2015-09/msg03985.html

Reference:
----------
  -> http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/09/15/2

This issue affects the versions of the qemu-kvm packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7.

This issue affects the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 based versions of qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This issue affects the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 based versions of the qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This has been rated as having Moderate security impact and is not currently
planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer

bugs.title: CVE-2015-5279 qemu: Heap overflow vulnerability in ne2000_receive() function [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-5279 qemu: Heap overflow vulnerability in ne2000_receive() function [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-5279 qemu: Heap overflow vulnerability in ne2000_receive() function

long_desc.thetext:
Qemu emulator built with the NE2000 NIC emulation support is vulnerable to a heap buffer overflow issue. It could occur when receiving packets over the network.

A privileged user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the Qemu instance or potentially execute arbitrary code on the host.

Upstream fix:
-------------
  -> https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2015-09/msg03984.html

Reference:
----------
  -> http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/09/15/3

Created attachment 1066783
Crash report

Statement: 

This issue affects the versions of kvm and xen packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

This issue affects the versions of the qemu-kvm packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.

This issue affects the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 based versions of qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

This issue does not affect the versions of the qemu-kvm packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

This issue does not affect the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 based versions of the qemu-kvm-rhev packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.

History repeats itself.

After reporting BZ1262251 and asking for patch backport in BZ1262901 qemu in Fedora is working much better for live merges. Nevertheless mirror operation fails in rare cases at a later stage when VM is doing heavy disk IO. 

Bugzilla gives BZ1233826 -> BZ1238585 as a possible fix. So I backported http://git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=cae98cb87d269c33d23b2bccd79bb8d99a60d811 to FC21 and the mirror operation is stable now.

Could it find its way into FC21/FC22 too?

qemu-2.1.3-11.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
If you want to test the update, you can install it with
$ su -c 'dnf --enablerepo=updates-testing update qemu'
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2015-16368
qemu-2.1.3-11.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by crobinso.
This update has obsoleted qemu-2.1.3-10.fc21, and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has been submitted for stable by crobinso.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
* CVE-2015-6815: net: e1000: infinite loop issue (bz #1260225)
* CVE-2015-6855: ide: divide by zero issue (bz #1261793)
* CVE-2015-5278: Infinite loop in ne2000_receive() (bz #1263284)
* CVE-2015-5279: Heap overflow vulnerability in ne2000_receive() (bz #1263287)
* Make block copy more stable (bz #1264416)
* Fix hang at start of live merge for large images (bz #1262901)

* CVE-2015-5225: heap memory corruption in vnc_refresh_server_surface (bz #1255899)
